intro: Adenanthe bicarpellata, commonly known as the two-chambered sandmat, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, commonly referred to as the ice plant family, and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves. The plant produces small, star-shaped yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in sandy or rocky soils. Adenanthe bicarpellata is known for its ability to store water in its leaves, making it well adapted to drought conditions.
